page.title: 13INTERVIEW WITH CELEBRITY
page.content: We interviewed{Mr Edward McGregor,}one of our best known senior citizens. At 85 he is full of fun and is very interested in young people. He was born in 1899 in Deanston and then his family moved to Doune in 1904 and has lived there ever since. His school life was very strict but happy. Children enjoyed ball games, marbles and skipping. They had to be in the house by 8 o'clock, even as older boys, to get up for school at 7 am. He went to the navy as a youny lad; on his return to Doune he admired the work that Erskine Hospital was doing so he started to row for charity. He is well known for the large amount of money he has raised through sponsors. He saw the building of Castle Hill Estate and the new housing since then. He prefers life now, but says the old times were good too.
